Framework

Creating framework and building a hosting website

Explore our FRAMEWORK

VIEW THE SITE

This project was a class group project for the Front End Web Development Certificate program.


The final result you can see above. I combined multiple roles for this project (web developer, web designer, and project manager). My contribution to this group project you can see on the Insites section in GitHub (ures name: DianaDi777)
As I mentioned, my role for this project was not just a web developer but also a project manager. In order to maintain the project, I created a Project Plan, Work Breakdown Structure, and a few other documents that helped to follow the "waterfall" project management flow. It significantly helped a team accomplish a project within a deadline and complete all the requirements.


The specifications for this project were the following:
Construct a full-functioning and usable web development framework (think Bootstrap, Foundation, etc.). The framework that your team will build should demonstrate all of the skills that youâ€™ve acquired throughout this program including HTML5, CSS3, SASS, JavaScript, jQuery, plugin development, Responsive Web Design, and more. The framework should meet a niche need - come up with an industry that would benefit for the framework and make sure to include features that those individuals/businesses would need in a framework.
